Docs.summary: Provides additional information regarding a transaction.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can query relevant information about a transaction by accessing the <xref:System.Transactions.Transaction.TransactionInformation%2A> proptery of the <xref:System.Transactions.Transaction> class. In this way, you can retrieve the status of any transaction object, including the current ambient transaction, by doing a call like `Transaction.Current.TransactionInfomation.Status`.

Docs.summary: Gets the creation time of the transaction.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.DateTime> that contains the creation time of the transaction.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is mainly used to determine if the transaction has been created for a substantial length of time. This timestamp is only accurate to within 1 second of the actual creation time.

Docs.returns: A <xref:System.DateTime> that contains the creation time of the transaction.

Docs.summary: Gets a unique identifier of the escalated transaction.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Guid> that contains the unique identifier of the escalated transaction.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the transaction is escalated to a two-phase commit transaction, this property returns its unique identifier. If the transaction is not escalated, the value is `null`.
For more information on how a transaction's management is escalated, see [Transaction Management Escalation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5b87ae58-8ccf-4b9b-9715-41e4aade89b7).

Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Guid> that contains the unique identifier of the escalated transaction.

Docs.summary: Gets a unique identifier of the transaction.
Docs.value: A unique identifier of the transaction.
Docs.returns: A unique identifier of the transaction.

Docs.summary: Gets the status of the transaction.
Docs.value: A that contains the status of the transaction.
Docs.returns: A that contains the status of the transaction.
